accessibility.text: Concluding Remarks
frame.png
GitHub Artefact
Concluding Remarks
frame.png
GitHub Artefact
A formal notion of mode-correctness for bidirectional typing has been formulated.
Decidability of bidirectional type synthesis and checking follows.
NB we do not precook bidirectional typing rules for introduction/elimination rules.
Concluding Remarks
frame.png
GitHub Artefact
A formal notion of mode-correctness for bidirectional typing has been formulated.
Decidability of bidirectional type synthesis and checking follows.
NB we do not precook bidirectional typing rules for introduction/elimination rules.
Everything is developed with Agda and the proof of type synthesis computes a typing derivation.
Concluding Remarks
frame.png
GitHub Artefact
Concluding Remarks
frame.png
GitHub Artefact
A formal notion of mode-correctness for bidirectional typing has been formulated.
Decidability of bidirectional type synthesis and checking follows.
NB we do not precook bidirectional typing rules for introduction/elimination rules.
Everything is developed with Agda and the proof of type synthesis computes a typing derivation.
Other notions, e.g., mode derivations with missing annotation, annotatability, are in the paper.
Generic bidirectional type synthesis (with some prior choice of bidirectional rules)?
See the following talk by Felicissimo.
Concluding Remarks
Thank you for your attention!
frame.png
GitHub Artefact
A formal notion of mode-correctness for bidirectional typing has been formulated.
Decidability of bidirectional type synthesis and checking follows.
NB we do not precook bidirectional typing rules for introduction/elimination rules.
Everything is developed with Agda and the proof of type synthesis computes a typing derivation.
Other notions, e.g., mode derivations with missing annotation, annotatability, are in the paper.
Generic bidirectional type synthesis (with some prior choice of bidirectional rules)?
See the following talk by Felicissimo.
